functionalAnalysis.conclusion: Clear escape function identified with experimental control demonstrated

procedure: Generalization programmed across settings and people

results.quantitativeData: Preference Assessment resulted in 75% reduction in problem behavior over 8 weeks. Baseline: 55 instances per session. Post-intervention: 2 instances per session.
results.maintenanceData: 1-month follow-up: Behavior remained at low levels (3-5 per session)
results.socialValidity: Teachers rated intervention as highly effective (4.6000000000000005/5.0 average rating)

significance.theoretical: Demonstrated Preference Assessment principles in applied setting with rigorous experimental design
significance.clinical: Preference Assessment shown effective for severe problem behavior across diverse populations
significance.impact: Study contributes to evidence base for Preference Assessment as scientifically supported intervention

examRelevance: Demonstrates Preference Assessment procedures aligned with BACB Task List. Shows application of functional assessment principles.
